author: Cahal Milmo
title: Inside Thatcher's failed bid to suppress infamous ‘Spycatcher’ memoir
text:
The desperate attempts by Margaret Thatcher’s government to halt publication of Spycatcher , the headline-grabbing memoir of a rogue ex-MI5 officer, are revealed in official files that show ministers contemplated threatening libraries and invoking wartime censorship powers.
Documents released at the National Archives lay bare the long – and ultimately fruitless – campaign in the mid-1980s to prevent the claims of Peter Wright, a former Security Service officer, reaching a British audience.
In a memo written in 1985 prior to Spycatcher’s publication, Mrs Thatcher described herself as feeling “utterly shattered” by Mr Wright’s allegations, which included the claim that former MI5 head Sir Roger Hollis had been a Soviet mole, and that the Security Service had plotted against Labour prime minister Sir Harold Wilson.
The incendiary allegations were later largely discredited.
But the nature of the claims, and the spectacle of a one-time senior officer from MI5 going public – at a time when the Government did not officially acknowledge the agency’s existence – strengthened resolve in Downing Street that Spycatcher should be suppressed.
As Mrs Thatcher put it: “The consequences of publication would be enormous.”
In 1985, the Government obtained a court order banning publication in the UK – although the book remained on sale in Scotland – and newspapers were served gag orders and tried for contempt of court for reporting on Mr Wright’s allegations.
The approach led Spycatcher’s publishers to seek an international audience, with the book first appearing in Australia and later the US.
The increasingly desperate, and futile, attempts by Margaret Thatcher’s government to suppress Spycatcher , the memoir of a renegade ex-MI5 officer, are laid bare in official files made public for the first time. But despite a failed attempt to obtain an injunction in Australia, and Spycatcher’s bestselling status across the Atlantic, the Government remained determined to prevent British readers from getting their hands on the book.
The National Archive documents reveal how, as travellers began to arrive from America with copies of Spycatcher , ministers considered invoking censorship powers passed at the outbreak of the Second World War to seize the imported books.
It was despite warnings from Trade and Industry Secretary Lord Young that he had been advised it “would not practice be possible” to intercept every copy.
Meanwhile, Arts minister Lord Richard Luce warned that an international conference of librarians could see a further influx of books from the US. A British librarian was threatened with legal action after claims that he intended to add an imported copy of Spycatcher to his collection.
The documents also show how pressure was put on the speaker of the House of Commons to neuter debate about the book among MPs.
And they reveal that ministers even considered trying to stop minutes from the European Parliament being seen in Britain after Labour MEPs read extracts from Spycatcher into the record.
Home Secretary Douglas Hurd warned that stopping HM Stationery Office (HMSO) from importing copies of the minutes risked putting the UK in breach of its treaty obligations.
Instead, he suggested that HMSO import only 10 copies and arrange for a Whitehall department to acquire the lot – with officials being advised to “procrastina[te]” if a member of the public wanted to buy one.
As it became clear that efforts to keep Spycatcher off the shelves were doomed, ministers discussed – and discounted – a plan to curtail Mr Wright’s Security Service pension on the basis that it would make the British government look petty and vengeful.
In an ironic twist, a top secret memo sent by Mr Hurd to Mrs Thatcher in 1988 suggested that the Spycatcher affair had undermined trust in the Security Service to the extent that a new law should be passed officially recognising MI5’s existence and putting its operations on a formal legal footing.
The Security Service Act was passed the following year.

author: Camilo Giraldo Álvarez"/>
title: Estudiante y docente de Envigado expusieron proyecto de biocombustibles en Dubái
text:
Envigado, Antioquia
Una estudiante y un docente de la Institución Educativa Comercial de Envigado, sur del Valle de Aburrá, participaron en el evento Be The Change, en la ciudad de Dubái, en los Emiratos Arabes, donde presentaron su propuesta titulada Prototipo para la obtención de biocombustible a partir de Microalga Chlorella Vulgaris y Dióxido de Carbono para la Purificación del Aire en Envigado. De este evento hicieron parte 35 países, entre ellos Ecuador, Chile, España, Estados Unidos y Japón.
El evento, originado en India, busca que los jóvenes se apropien de su entorno y produzcan soluciones innovadoras a temas como el efecto invernadero y el uso de combustibles fósiles. La participación del evento internacional fue producto de un reto de la Fundación Terpel a nivel nacional, del cual fueron finalistas y lograron su tiquete al medio oriente.
John Alexander Echeverri, docente que hizo parte del proyecto y viajó a Dubái, explicó en que consiste la propuesta presentada en los Emiratos Árabes.
“Nos permitieron mejorar nuestro proyecto y a la vez obtener los recursos. Nosotros transformamos el humo contaminado y el aceite de cocina en biocombustible y esta experiencia se compartió en Dubai con diferentes comunidades que tienen la misma problemática y ayudarlos con nuestro proyecto a mejorar la calidad del aire”.
El docente agregó que el biocombustible puede ser utilizado en maquinaria de alta demanda energética sin dañar el ecosistema. Este proyecto se destacó entre 137 iniciativas y fue una de las cuatro ganadoras del reto de 2023.
María Fernanda Salazar es la estudiante de la Institución Educativa Comercial de Envigado que, junto con su docente, estructuró el proyecto merecedor del viaje y se mostró agradecida por la oportunidad.
“Estuvimos en Dubái y fue una experiencia súper bonita, pudimos compartir nuestro proyecto, pudimos ver el proyecto de muchísimos otros estudiantes que estuvieron en la reunión. Solo quería agradecerles por esa oportunidad tan bonita y esa experiencia tan maravillosa que tuvo en nuestras vidas”.
Le puede interesar: 26 casos de violencia intrafamiliar se registran diariamente en Medellín
Por último, con este tipo de acciones la Fundación Terpel busca el fortalecimiento de habilidades en innovación, liderazgo y creatividad en niños, niñas, jóvenes y docentes de diversas regiones al brindarles las herramientas digitales y acompañamiento para fortalecer cada una de sus iniciativas.

author: LMNeuquen
title: Quién era el motociclista que murió contra un muro en la Doctor Ramón
text:
No hay precisiones si se trató de un accidente en solitario, por algún desperfecto o mala maniobra, o si existió la participación de otro vehículo. Cuando la Policía y el equipo del SIEN llegaron, el motociclista yacía tirado a pocos metros de su moto de 800 centímetros cúbicos.
Todo ocurrió en la noche del miércoles, poco después de las 20:30 horas, sobre la calle Doctor Ramón, en el puente aéreo que cruza la avenida Raúl Alfonsín (la trama urbana de la ruta 7).
Allí por "por causas que se investigan", el hombre impactó de lleno el muro de contención que divide los carriles. El impacto fue mortal, a pesar de los esfuerzos médicos.
accidente fatal motociclista.jpg El motociclista chocó contra el muro de contención que divide los carriles sobre Dr. Ramón.
Según pudo conocer LMN se trataba de un experimentado motociclista, conocido y consultado en las redes sociales por su conocimiento. Además, el ingeniero electrónico. La víctima del fatal siniestro es Rubén Mirabete , de 63 años.
Los investigadores de Accidentología de la Policía avanzaban en las pesquisas de las cámaras urbanas en las inmediaciones, además de las que existen en los alrededores, como las del Alto Comahue Shopping o el nuevo gimnasio Hoka.
La investigación judicial está a cargo de la fiscal Lucrecia Sola.
image.png

author: @latestly
title: World News | Pak's Islamic Educational Institute Issues Fatwa Declaring TikTok as 'Illegal and Haram'
text:
Karachi [Pakistan], December 24 (ANI): Jamia Binoria Town, a prominent religious school in Karachi, the capital of Sindh province, has issued a fatwa (a religious decree) declaring the use of TikTok illegal and haram, terming it the biggest temptation of the modern era, Pakistani vernacular media reported.
In Fatwa No. (144211200409), the institution outlined ten reasons supporting its stance.
Also Read |
Indonesia: 12 Dead, 39 Injured in Explosion at Nickel-Processing Plant.
In the past, religious scholars have been calling for a ban on TikTok as a reason for spreading immorality, and a partial ban has also been imposed on TikTok time and again in Pakistan, Dawn News TV reported.
The fatwa, delivered online by Jamia Binoria, asserts that TikTok poses an increasing danger as a fitna (temptation) in the present age and is considered illegal and haram from a Shariah perspective.
Also Read |
Israel-Hamas War: Eight More Israeli Soldiers Killed in Gaza, Death Toll Reaches 152, Says IDF.
Among the reasons cited, the app's inclusion of photos and videos of animals is deemed forbidden in Sharia, and the creation and dissemination of obscene videos by women on the platform is highlighted, Dawn News TV report added.
Furthermore, the fatwa condemns the practice of men and women on TikTok making videos involving dancing and singing, which is viewed as a means of spreading obscenity and nudity, deemed a waste of time and leading to moral decay.
Jamia Banoria's fatwa underscores that TikTok not only contains videos that mock scholars and religion but is a platform where everything can be subjected to mockery and ridicule.
According to the fatwa, as reported by Dawn News TV, engaging with TikTok inevitably involves participating in activities that are considered sinful in Sharia, making it nearly impossible to avoid falling into such transgressions. Consequently, the fatwa declares the use of TikTok impermissible.
With over 39 million downloads in 2022 alone, TikTok, owned by China-based ByteDance, is under increasing scrutiny and calls for bans worldwide, including in Pakistan, according to data from Sensor Tower, a mobile and digital analytics firm, The Express Tribune reported.
Earlier this year, a petition was filed in the Lahore High Court, urging a ban on the TikTok application. The petition highlighted concerns about the platform's perceived detrimental effects on the youth of society, adding to the growing chorus of voices advocating for restrictions.
In 2021, the Pakistan Telecommunication Authority imposed a five-month ban on the video-sharing app from July to November. The ban was lifted after TikTok provided assurances that it would enhance measures to control indecent or immoral content on the platform, The Express Tribune reported. (ANI)
(This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)

organizations.name: islamic educational institute issues fatwa declaring tiktok

author: 网易
title: 杨瀚森空降杭州！明晚国家队首秀，郭士强亮出底牌，CCTV5直播|周琦|胡金秋|奥运会_网易订阅
text:
就在刚刚，波特兰开拓者队的新星 杨瀚森 突然结束NBA夏季联赛，紧急飞回国内！ 这位中国男篮唯一的现役NBA球员，落地后直奔杭州奥体中心体育馆。 他的目标很明确：明晚7点半，身披国家队战袍迎战南美劲旅委内瑞拉！
这将是杨瀚森入选国家队后的正式比赛首秀。 主帅 郭士强 直接放出狠招，把他和CBA顶级内线胡金秋同时摆进首发阵容，组成“双塔”迎敌！
中国男篮全队已在昨晚抵达杭州。 17名球员拖着行李箱走出机场时， 胡金秋 和赵睿走在队伍最前面。 他们刚结束在欧洲的两周拉练，打了4场高强度热身赛，连时差都没倒完就直奔赛场。
明晚（7月24日）和后天（25日）的晚上7点半，杭州奥体中心体育馆将连续两晚爆满。 这里曾是亚运会决赛场地，现在18000个座位早被抢光，1980元的VIP票开票即秒空。 球迷们举着“杭州等男篮久矣”的标语，就等这场中委大战开场。
主教练郭士强压力不小。 他去年7月接手球队，目标直指2028年奥运会，但这次亚洲杯是首场大考。 三大主力周琦、张镇麟、曾凡博全部因伤退出，连老将赵继伟也没进名单。
队长赵睿的担子最重。 作为后场核心，他得扛起进攻组织大旗，还要带着胡明轩、徐杰这些年轻后卫顶住委内瑞拉的强硬对抗。 赛前训练时，他反复加练三分，背心早就湿透。
内线现在全靠胡金秋苦撑。 他带着徐昕、余嘉豪两名年轻中锋，三人要轮番对抗委内瑞拉平均身高超2米的壮汉内线。 训练中胡金秋加练了20次篮下强打，喘着气说：“得把周琦的份儿一起拼回来！ ”
对手委内瑞拉来势汹汹。 他们世界排名第25，比中国队高5位。 2019年世界杯上，他们曾以72-59碾压中国队。 这次派出的阵容里，有4名球员打过上届美洲杯决赛，身体对抗堪称“钢筋铁骨”。
杨瀚森的回归堪称及时雨。 他在NBA夏季联赛场均砍下10.8分+5.3篮板+3.8助攻，开拓者教练组都惊呼“这新秀会传球！ ”。 得知国家队内线告急，他立刻退掉最后一场比赛飞回国。
郭士强为他量身打造了新战术。训练中，杨瀚森多次和胡金秋演练高低位配合：他站罚球线策应，胡金秋顺下空切。 这套打法专破委内瑞拉的紧逼防守，连场边记者都直呼“没见过！ ”
球迷最担心杨瀚森的脚踝。 上周夏季联赛中，他曾被对手压到脚痛苦倒地。 队医透露已为他定制护踝，但郭士强明确表示：“会控制他的出场时间，绝不冒险！ ”
今晚的杭州奥体注定沸腾。 场馆里挂起巨幅标语“为城而战”，灯光师调试着NBA同款炫彩射灯。 球员通道里，赵睿把队友们聚在一起吼道：“六年没赢过他们了！ 今晚必须拿下！ ”

author: @MaxMaxxbakh
title: Highest-second warning level imposed at NATO airfield situated in North Rhine-Westphalia
text: Unveiling the Known Facts and the Unknown Aspects. - Elevated alarm status at NATO's second-highest airbase in North Rhine-Westphalia The NATO has increased the alert level at its base in Geilenkirchen, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, to its second-highest level. As a preventative measure, non-essential personnel have been sent home. This move was prompted by intelligence reports suggesting a potential threat. Details on the NATO base alert in Geilenkirchen The current security level, referred to as Charlie in NATO lingo, indicates that a possible incident has occurred or there's strong evidence of an impending terrorist action against the alliance. The spokesperson for the base near Aachen clarified, "This isn't a cause for panic; it's merely a precautionary measure to ensure we can maintain our critical operations." Regrettably, additional details about the circumstances leading to this heightened alert level were not disclosed. Last Thursday evening, the police confirmed an ongoing operation without providing further details or numbers of personnel involved. On Friday morning, a police spokesperson in Cologne indicated that there were no further updates at that time. An on-site dpa reporter observed police vehicles on the base, and digital displays at the entrance showed security level C. Geilenkirchen's early warning system - AWACS The NATO has positioned its flying early warning system, AWACS, in Geilenkirchen. With fourteen Boeing 707 aircraft, this multinational unit monitors airspace to spot potential dangers and alert the alliance. These aircraft carry out classic air and sea surveillance, and serve as flying command centers during operations. The unit has participated in various operations, like those in the Balkans and Afghanistan. After Russia invaded Ukraine, NATO temporarily deployed aircraft to Romania. AWACS stands for Airborne Early Warning and Control System. With a range of 9,250 kilometers, these aircraft can detect and identify other aircraft up to 400 kilometers away. They feature a large radar antenna that resembles a mushroom on the back. Suspected sabotage a week ago Around a week ago, suspicions of sabotage arose at several German military bases. However, following investigations, the all-clear was given. Police and state security were investigating a security incident at the Cologne-Wahn air force base waterworks due to water contamination suspicions. Similarly, Geilenkirchen saw suspicious activities, with an individual within proximity to the airport being apprehended for questioning. Regrettably, the accusations against this individual could not be proven. What remains unknown The reasons for this heightened security level in Geilenkirchen and the underlying circumstances are still largely inconclusive. Neither the police, Ministry of Defense, nor NATO have revealed any information on this matter. Possible connections: Last Thursday, multiple drones were reportedly spotted over an industrial area in Brunsbüttel. However, both their origin and target remain unknown. Whether this is linked to the heightened security level in Geilenkirchen is likewise undetermined. Likewise, the connection between sabotage incidents at several German military facilities a week ago and the elevated security level in Geilenkirchen remains uncertain. Following inspections, the all-clear was given. The police and the state security department investigated a security incident at the Cologne-Wahn air force base waterworks due to suspicions of contaminated drinking water. In Geilenkirchen, too, suspicious activities were observed. Reports from safety sources revealed that an individual within the airport vicinity was detained for questioning. However, no confirmation of suspicions against this individual was forthcoming. Restricted air traffic: Whether air traffic at the Geilenkirchen air force support base can resume on Friday was unclear. At first, a NATO AWACS spokesperson in Geilenkirchen indicated that the heightened security level might persist until Friday morning. The current security level at the NATO base in Geilenkirchen, known as Charlie, indicates a potential threat or incident, justifying the base's heightened alert level. Despite the ongoing investigations and precautionary measures, the specific reasons behind this increased security level remain undefined and undisclosed by relevant authorities.

author: Marco Vargas
title: Santiago Giménez rompe el silencio y manda advertencia a los que no creen en la Selección Mexicana
text: Tras la dura derrota de 1 - 0 de México ante Venezuela, Santiago Giménez alzó la voz tras las duras criticas que le llovieron a la [Selección Mexicana. ](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/deportes/hijos-de-conmebol-argentinos-se-burlan-de-la-seleccion-mexicana-tras-derrota-vs-venezuela/) [Santiago Giménez](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/deportes/son-2-equipos-los-que-quieren-a-santi-gimenez-uno-es-de-espana-y-el-otro-de-inglaterra/), hoy delantero titular de la [Selección Mexicana](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/deportes/guillermo-almada-andre-jardine-y-martin-anselmi-los-candidatos-si-jaime-lozano-fracasa/) ocupó su cuenta de X, antes Twitter para mandar un contundente mensaje a aquellos que no creen en el Tri. “Resultado difícil de aceptar, pero esto aún no termina… Vamos con todo por el pase”, fue el breve, pero contundente mensaje del goleador Azteca. En los comentarios, la mayoría fue de apoyo, entre los que destaca el de Gabriel Montiel, mejor conocido como Werevertumorro, quien escribió: “CREO EN TI”, esto también a raíz de las críticas que recibe Santi por parte de la afición y los medios de comunicación. ¿México ya está eliminado de la Copa América 2024? Si bien, hasta el momento la [Selección Mexicana](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/deportes/seleccion-mexicana-al-borde-de-la-eliminacion-en-copa-america-que-necesita-para-pasar-a-cuartos-de-final/) marcha como tercera en el Grupo B, aún depende de si misma para calificar a los Octavos de Final de la Copa América 2024. México suma únicamente tres puntos, ya que consiguió un agónico triunfo ante Jamaica y perdió su segundo partido ante la Selección de Venezuela 1 - 0. El último rival de México es Ecuador, quien se encuentra un escalón arriba gracias a la diferencia de goles, ya que cuenta con los mismos puntos de México. Por lo que si México desea superar la Fase de Grupos, tendrá que vencer a Ecuador, ya que el empate faverecería a la Selección Sudamericana. ¿Cuándo juega la Selección Mexicana ante Ecuador? México buscará su pase ante [Ecuador ](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/deportes/robo-a-la-concacaf-asi-fue-el-polemico-triunfo-de-ecuador-vs-jamaica-no-se-marco-una-mano-clarisima/)y la Selección Mexicana está obligada a ganarle al conjunto ecuatoriano si desea acceder a los Octavos de Final. Venezuela es el primero clasificado a la siguiente ronda, ya que logró vencer a Ecuador y a México, por lo que con seis puntos y a falta de un partido ya está la siguiente fase. México vs Ecuador. - Fecha domingo 30 de junio - Hora: 18:00 horas tiempo del Centro de México - Sede: Estadio de la Universidad de Phoenix - Dónde ver: VIX, Canal 5, Canal y TUDN
